physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Abdomen was soft with mild epigastric tenderness without rebound; stool specimen revealed occult blood.
Mild abdominal tenderness; blood levels of haptoglobin, glucose, folic acid, vitamin B12, ferritin, phosphorus, and magnesium were normal.
Abdomen was soft with mild epigastric tenderness without rebound; stool was black and positive for occult blood (trace).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure increased to 200 mm Hg and pulse to 94 bpm after treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Red-cell casts, hyaline casts, oxalate crystals, and no malignant cells observed in urine.
Progressive anemia observed; hemoglobin decreased to 8.9 g/dL before transfusion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit fell to 24.5% then rose to 30.4% after transfusion.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Creamy appearance of urine due to red cells.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hemoglobin maintained at 10 g/dL with intermittent erythropoietin.
